alert.note: Alert for North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: High Surf Warning issued April 04 at 2:59PM PDT until April 05 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Large waves and dangerous surf conditions, with high potential of sneaker waves. Breakers up to 34 feet. * WHERE...In Oregon, North Oregon Coast. In Washington, South Washington Coast. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Destructive waves may wash over beaches, jetties, and other structures unexpectedly. People can be swept off rocks and jetties and drown while observing high surf. Severe beach erosion may destroy coastal properties and buildings. Higher than normal water run-up is expected on beaches and low- lying shoreline. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest surf will occur after dark making it especially difficult to see the rapidly changing conditions and shifting debris on the beaches. The incoming swells are coming from near due west.
info.instruction: A High Surf Warning means that high surf will affect beaches, producing rip currents, sneaker waves and beach erosion. Stay well back from the water`s edge and be alert for exceptionally high waves. Keep away from large logs on the beach. Water running up on the beach can lift or roll logs which can injure or kill someone caught in their path.
